attributes.action: investigate and compensate small businesses for the losses incurred from the adjustments made to the Flat Rate VAT scheme as of 1/12/08.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As of 1/12/08, VAT was reduced to 15%. The flat rate scheme however was only reduced by 1.5%. For every £1000 pounds invoiced net of VAT, small service companies availing of the Flat Rate Scheme at 13% (reduced to 11.5%) are now £4.50 worse off.

I quote "Alongside the temporary reduction of the standard rate of VAT, the government will also amend the sectoral rates of the VAT flat-rate scheme in line with the standard rate reduction, allowing 180,000 small businesses in the scheme to benefit,"

In fact, a service company turning over £150,000 per year will be £675 worse off. I propose that the PM and Mr Darling examine this and put in place changes to the Flat Rate percentages so that they keep their promises. I also want any changes back dated to 1/12/08.
